intro: Fleischmannia langlassei, commonly known as the Langlasse's fleischmannia, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand prolonged periods of drought. Its flowers, which bloom in late spring or early summer, are often pink or purple in color and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Fleischmannia langlassei is considered a rare and endangered species.
